metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5097 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability can occur during XSL transformations when the source document for the transformation is manipulated by script content during the transformation. This results in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 52.6, Firefox ESR < 52.6, and Firefox < 58.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5097` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required
